name: China
introduction: For centuries China stood as a leading civilization outpacing the rest of the world in the arts and sciences but in the 19th and early 20th centuries the country was beset by civil unrest major famines military defeats and foreign occupation. After World War II the communists under MAO Zedong established an autocratic socialist system that while ensuring China's sovereignty imposed strict controls over everyday life and cost the lives of tens of millions of people. After 1978 MAO's successor DENG Xiaoping and other leaders focused on market-oriented economic development and by 2000 output had quadrupled. For much of the population living standards have improved dramatically and the room for personal choice has expanded yet political controls remain tight. Since the early 1990s China has increased its global outreach and participation in international organizations.
overview: 'China is a populous nation in East Asia whose vast landscape encompasses grassland desert mountains lakes rivers and more than 14000km of coastline. Capital Beijing mixes modern architecture with historic sites such as the Forbidden City palace complex and Tiananmen Square. Shanghai is a skyscraper-studded global financial center. The iconic Great Wall of China runs east-west across the country''s north.'

languages.name: Achang
languages.area: Dehong Dai-Jingpo Autonomous Prefecture and Baoshan District, western Yunnan Province, along the Myanmar border, Longchuan, Liangge, and Luxi counties; Baoshan Prefecture, Tengchong and Longling counties; Dali Bai Autonomous Prefecture, Yunlong County. Also in Myanmar.

languages.name: Adi
languages.area: Arunachal Pradesh, East, West, and Upper Siang districts, Upper Subansiri and Dibang Valley districts; Assam, north hills of Assam Valley, between Bhutan and the Buruli River. Also in Bhutan, China.

languages.name: Amdo Tibetan
languages.area: Huangnan, Hainan, Haibei, and Guoluo (Golog) Tibetan autonomous prefectures; Qinghai Province, Haixi Mongolian-Tibetan-Kazakh Autonomous Prefecture; Gannan Tibetan Autonomous Prefecture, southwest Gansu Province, Tianzhu Autonomous County; west and north Sichuan Province, Ganzi, Aba (Ngawa) Tibetan autonomous prefectures.

languages.name: Akeu
languages.area: South Yunnan Province, Xishuangbanna Prefecture, most villages in Jinhong County, some in Mengla County. Also in Laos, Myanmar, Thailand.

languages.name: Akha
languages.area: Shan state, east Kengtung District. Also in China, Laos, Thailand, Viet Nam.

languages.name: Chinese Ainu
languages.area: Southwest Xinjiang Autonomous Region, Hetian, Luopu, Moyu, Shache, Yingjisha, and Shulekuche counties; Kashgar area, Yengixar (Shule) town, Hanalik and Paynap villages, and Gewoz village near Hoban.

languages.name: Ai-Cham
languages.area: Qiannan Buyi-Miao Autonomous Prefecture, southern Guizhou Province, Libo County, Di’e and Boyao townships. 13 villages.

languages.name: Amis
languages.area: Between Hualien and Taitung, valley plains and east coast by the sea.

languages.name: Zaiwa
languages.area: Yunnan Province, Dehong Dai-Jingpo Autonomous Prefecture, Luxi, Ruili, Longchuan, Yingjiang, Bangwa districts. Also in Myanmar.

languages.name: Northern Altai
languages.area: Gorno-Altai Ao mountains, Mongolia and China border.

languages.name: Alugu
languages.area: Yunnan Province, Yuanyang County, Fengchunling District across the Honghe River; Gejiu County, Manhao District.

languages.name: Azha
languages.area: Yunnan Province, primarily along the border between Wenshan and Yanshan counties.

languages.name: Bugan
languages.area: Southeast Yunnan Province, Wenshan Zhuang and Miao Autonomous Prefecture, Guangnan and Xichou counties, South Guangnan Nasa Township, 4 Bugan villages: Laowalong, Xinwalong, Xinpingzhai and Nala; Guangnan County, Zhuanjiao District, 2 Bugan villages: Jiuping, Shibeipo; Northern Yanshan County, Jijie District, Manlong and 6 other villages.

languages.name: Central Bai
languages.area: Northwest Yunnan, Jianchuan, Heqing, Lanping, Eryuan, and Yunlong.

languages.name: Panyi Bai
languages.area: Northwest Yunnan, Nujiang, and Lanping.

languages.name: Gahri
languages.area: Himachal Pradesh, Gahr Valley along Bhaga River from confluence with the Chandra and upstream, Biling, Kardang, Kyelang, Guskyar, Yurnad, Gumrang, Barbog, Paspara, Pyukar, Styering villages.

languages.name: Bit
languages.area: Near the north border with China, northeast of Namtha, Luand Namtha Province, and south of Boun Neua; Phongsali Province, Boun-Tai, Samphan, and Khoa districts, 8 villages. Also in China.

languages.name: Biao-Jiao Mien
languages.area: Northeast Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region, Quanzhou, Guanyang, and Gongcheng Yao autonomous counties; south Hunan Province, Shuangpai, and Daoxian counties.

languages.name: Blang
languages.area: Southwest Yunnan Province, Xishuangbanna Dai Autonomous Prefecture, Menghai County, Bulangshan, Bada, Xiding, Daluo districts; Jinghong County, Damengnong District. Also in Myanmar, Thailand.

languages.name: Tai Dam
languages.area: North, along Red and Black rivers; now settled south in Tung Nghia (Lam Dam), Tho Thanh (Dac Lac), Pleiku (Gia Lai), elsewhere. Also in Australia, China, France, Laos, Thailand, United States.

languages.name: Biao Mon
languages.area: Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region, Mengshan, Zhaoping, Pingle, Lipu, and Gongcheng counties.

languages.name: Bunun
languages.area: East central plain, south of the Sediq (Taroko) [trv].

languages.name: Tibetan
languages.area: Tibet, Sichuan, Qinghai. Also in Bhutan, India, Nepal, Norway, Switzerland, Taiwan, United States.

languages.name: Dzao Min
languages.area: North Guangdong Province, Liannan and Yangshan counties; south Hunan Province, Yizhang County.

languages.name: Baima
languages.area: North-central Sichuan Province, Pingwu, Nanping, and Songpan counties; Gansu Province, Wen County.

languages.name: Younuo Bunu
languages.area: Northeast Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region, Xing’an and Longsheng counties.

languages.name: Wunai Bunu
languages.area: West Hunan Province, Longhui, Xupu, Tongdao, Chenxi, Dongkou, Cengbu, and Xinning counties.

languages.name: Bu-Nao Bunu
languages.area: West Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region, counties: Du’an, Bama, Dahua, Lingyun, Nandan, Tiandong, Tianyang, Pingguo, Fengshan, Donglan, Hechi, Mashan, Bose, Tianlin, Leye, Tiandeng, Xincheng, Shanglin, Long’an, Debao, Laibin, Luocheng counties; Guizhou Province, Libo County; Yunnan Province, Funing County.

languages.name: Pela
languages.area: Yunnan Province, Dehong Prefecture, Luxi County, Santaishan Township; Yingjiang, Lianghe counties. Maybe also Myanmar.

languages.name: China Buriat
languages.area: Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region, Hulun-Buyr District, near Russia (Siberia) and Mongolia borders.

languages.name: Biao
languages.area: Guangdong Province, southwest corner of Huaiji County (Shidong, Yonggu, Dagang, Liangcun, and Qiaotou districts); Fengkai County, Chang’an, Jinzhuang and Qixing districts, several villages.

languages.name: Biyo
languages.area: Yunnan Province, southeast Simao Prefecture, Mojiang, Jiangcheng, Zhenyuan, Jingdong counties.

languages.name: Bisu
languages.area: Southwest Yunan Province, Xishuangbanna Dai Autonomous Prefecture, Menghai County, Mengzhe village; Simao Prefecture, Lancang Lahu Autonomous County, Zhutang, Laba, Donglang, and Fubang villages; Meglian Dai, Lahu, and Va autonomous counties, Jingxin, Fuyan, and Nanya villages; parts of Ximeng Va Autonomous County. Possibly also in Laos. Also in Myanmar, Thailand.

languages.name: Choni
languages.area: South Gansu Province, east Gannan Prefecture, Lintan, Zhuoni, Diebu and Zhouqu counties.

languages.name: Min Dong Chinese
languages.area: Fujian, Fu’an in northeast to Fuzhou in east central. Also in Brunei, Indonesia (Java and Bali), Malaysia (Peninsular), Singapore, Thailand, United States.

languages.name: Chadong
languages.area: Northeast Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region, Lingui County, Guilin Muncipality; Chadong District (most villages), Liangjiang Township; Yongfu County, Longjiang District.

languages.name: Jinyu Chinese
languages.area: Mainly in Shanxi Province; some in Shaanxi and Henan provinces.

languages.name: Idu-Mishmi
languages.area: Arunachal Pradesh, Dibang Valley District; Assam; West Bengal. Also in China.

languages.name: Mandarin Chinese
languages.area: Widespread north of Changjiang River, a belt south of the Changjiang from Qiujiang (Jiangxi) to Zhenjiang (Jiangsu), Hubei, except southeast corner, Sichuan, Yunnan, Guizhou, northwest part of Guangxi, and northwest corner of Hunan. Also in Brunei, Cambodia, Canada, Indonesia (Java and Bali), Laos, Libya, Malaysia (Peninsular), Mauritius, Mongolia, Mozambique, Philippines, Russian Federation (Asia), Singapore, Taiwan, Thailand, United Kingdom, United States, Viet Nam, Zambia.

languages.name: Changthang
languages.area: Jammu and Kashmir, Tibet border area, Changthang region east and southeast of Leh.

languages.name: Northern Qiang
languages.area: North central Sichuan Province, Mao, Songpan, Heishui, Beichuan counties.

languages.name: Cao Miao
languages.area: Southeast Guizhou Province, Liping County; southwest Hunan Province, Tongdao Dong Autonomous County; northeast Guangxi, Sanjiang Dong Autonomous County, near South Dong, small villages.

languages.name: Pu-Xian Chinese
languages.area: East central Fujian Province, Putian and Xianyou counties. Also in Malaysia (Peninsular), Singapore.

languages.name: Chuanqiandian Cluster Miao
languages.autonym: lus Hmoob / lug Moob / lol Hmongb
languages.area: West Guizhou, west Guangxi, south Sichuan, Yunnan (especially southeast and northeast).

languages.name: Chinese Sign Language
languages.area: Also in Malaysia (Peninsular), Taiwan.

languages.name: Cun
languages.area: North Dongfang County, south bank of Changhua River, north bank in Changjiang County, Hainan Island.

languages.name: Tai Ya
languages.area: Central and South Yunnan Province, Yuxi Prefecture, Xinping Yi-Dai Autonomous County, Mosha District; Yuanjiang Hani, Yi, Dai autonomous counties; Honghe Hani and Yi Autonomous Prefecture, Yuanyang and Honghe counties. Also in Thailand.

languages.name: Huizhou Chinese
languages.area: South Anhui Province, Huizhou region and Jixi, She (Xi), Ningguo, Jingde, Tunxi, Xiuning, Yi, Qimen and Dongzhi counties; northern Zhejiang Province, Chun’an County, Jiande municipality; northeast Jiangxi Province, Wuyuan, Dexing and Fuliang counties.

languages.name: Min Zhong Chinese
languages.area: Central Fujian Province, Sha County, Yong’an and Sanming municipalities.

languages.name: Northern Dong
languages.area: Area where west Hunan and north Guangxi provinces meet, southeast Guizhou (Yuping Autonomous County); Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region. 20 contiguous counties. Also in Viet Nam.

languages.name: Daur
languages.area: Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region, Hulun Buir League, Hailar Prefecture, Morin Dawa (Molidawa) Daur Autonomous Banner, Oroqen Autonomous Banner and Ewenki Autonomous Banner; Heilongjiang Province, Nenjiang Prefecture, Fuyu and Nehe counties; Qiqihar Prefecture, Qiqihar City; northwest Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region, Tacheng Prefecture (Ili dialect). Also in Mongolia.

languages.name: Drung
languages.area: Dulong River dialect in far northwest Yunnan, Gongshan Dulong-Nu Autonomous County, both sides of the Dulong River. Nu River dialect from Gongshan Dulong-Nu Autonomous County west to Chayu (Zayü) County in Tibet.

languages.name: E
languages.area: North Guangxi -Zhuang Autonomous Region, Rongshui Hmong Autonomous County, Yongle District, Xiatan, Simo, Xinglong (Xingyou) and other villages; Luocheng Mulam Autonomous County border areas.

languages.name: Enu
languages.area: Simao municipality, Mojiang County, Yayi, Baliu, and Sinanjiang townships; Jiangcheng County, Jiahe, and Qushui townships; Honghe Prefecture, Luchun County.

languages.name: Horpa
languages.area: Sichuan Province, Ganzi (Garzê) Tibetan Autonomous Prefecture, Danba (=Rongzhag), Daofu (Dawu), Luhuo, Xinlong (Nyagrong) counties; Aba (Ngawa) Tibetan-Qiang Autonomous Prefecture, Jinchua (Quqên) County; Ganzi Prefecture, Chengguan District, Central and eastern Daofu County; Wari District, Wari, Xiajia, and Muru townships; Bamei District, Shazhong Township; Danba County, Dasang District, Geshiza, Bianer, and Dandong townships; Chuangu District, Donggu Township; Jinchuan District, Bawang, Jinchuan townships. Scattered communities in Hexi District, Manqing, Zhuwo, and Duoshan townships; Xialatuo District, Renda Township.

languages.name: Ersu
languages.area: South central Sichuan, lower reaches of the Dadu River; Liangshan Yi Autonomous Prefecture, Ganluo, Yuexi, Mianning, and Muli counties; Ya’an Prefecture, Shimian and Hanyuan counties; Ganzi Tibetan Autonomous Prefecture, Jiulong County; dispersed among Yi, Chinese, and Tibetan peoples.

languages.name: Evenki
languages.area: Inner Mongolia: Hulunbuir banners; Ewenki, Moriadawa, Oronchon, Chen Bargu, Arong, Ergune East, and Huisuomu; Heilongjiang Province, Nale Prefecture; a few in Xinjiang. Also in Mongolia, Russian Federation (Asia), United States.

languages.name: Foma
languages.area: Orientale Province, Congo River north side, upstream from Basoko.

languages.name: Gan Chinese
languages.area: Jiangxi and southeast corner of Hubei including Dachi, Xianning, Jiayu, Chongyang, and parts of Anhui, Hunan, and Fujian provinces. Chang-Jing in Nanchang City, Xiuhui, and Jing’an; Yi-Liu in Yichun (Ichun) in Jiangxi, Liuyang in Hunan.

languages.name: Green Gelao
languages.area: Yen Minh District, Pho La and Dong Van.

languages.name: Red Gelao
languages.area: Yen Minh District.

languages.name: White Gelao
languages.area: Yen Minh District, Pho La and Dong Van.

languages.name: Nanai
languages.area: Extreme far east, confluence of Amur and Ussuri rivers, scattered in Ussuri Valley and Sikhote-Alin, centered in Amur Valley below Khabarovsk. Also in China.

languages.name: Guiqiong
languages.area: West central Sichuan, Ganzi (Garzê) Tibetan Autonomous Prefecture, Luding County, plateaus on both sides of the Dadu River north; northwest Tianquan County. One town is Wasigou.

languages.name: Groma
languages.area: Chambi Valley, between Sikkim and Bhutan, Tibet. Also in India.

languages.name: Hakka Chinese
languages.autonym: 客家話 / 客家话 Hak-kâ-fa
languages.area: Widespread with other dialects. Eastern and northeastern Guangdong greatest concentration; also in Fujian, Jiangxi, Guangxi, Hunan, and Sichuan. Also in Brunei, Canada, French Guiana, French Polynesia, Indonesia (Java and Bali), Malaysia (Peninsular), Mauritius, New Zealand, Panama, Singapore, South Africa, Suriname, Taiwan, Thailand, United Kingdom, United States.

languages.name: Northern Qiandong Miao
languages.area: East and south Guizhou Province, Majiang, Danzhai, Leishan, Taijiang, Huangping, Shibing, Jianhe, Zhenyuan, Sansui, Fuquan, Pingba, Zhenning, Xingren, Anlong, Guanling, Zhenfeng and Ziyun counties, Kaili Qingzhen municipalities; northwest Guangxi Province, Longlin County.

languages.name: Hong Kong Sign Language
languages.area: Hong Kong, SAR.

languages.name: Hlersu
languages.area: Central Yunnan Province, Zhenyuan and Shuangbai counties, scattered mountaintop locations; Yuanjiang County, 38 villages; Xinping County, 40 villages; Eshan County, 6 villages; Shiping County, 5 villages.

languages.name: Southern Mashan Hmong
languages.area: South Guizhou Province, Wangmo County.

languages.name: Central Huishui Hmong
languages.area: Central Guizhou Province, Huishui and Changshun counties, suburbs of south Guiyang Municipality.

languages.name: Large Flowery Miao
languages.area: Northwest Guizhou Province, Weining, Hezhang, Shuicheng, Pu’an, Zhenning, and Ziyun counties, Liupanshui municipality; northeast and central Yunnan Province, Zhaotong area, Yongshan, Yiliang, Daguan, Suijiang, Qiaojia, Xundian, Fumin, Luquan, Lufeng, and Wuding counties, Xuanwei, Qujing, Kunming, Anning and Chuxiong municipalities; south Sichuan Province, Panzhihua municipality.

languages.name: Eastern Huishui Hmong
languages.area: Central and south Guizhou Province, Huishui, Pingba, Luodian counties.

languages.name: Southwestern Guiyang Hmong
languages.area: Central Guizhou Province, Pingba, Changshun counties, suburbs of Guiyang, Qingzhen, Anshun municipalities.

languages.name: Northern Huishui Hmong

languages.name: Ge
languages.area: East central Guizhou: Huangping County, Chong’an Township; Kaili Municipality, Longchang Township.

languages.name: Luopohe Hmong
languages.area: Central Guizhou east of Guiyang, Weng’an, Guiding, Longli, Kaiyang counties, Fuquan and Kaili municipalities.

languages.name: Central Mashan Hmong
languages.area: South central Guizhou Province, Ziyun, Wangmo and Luodian counties.

languages.name: Northern Mashan Hmong
languages.area: South central Guizhou Province, Changshun, Luodian and Huishui counties.

languages.name: Eastern Qiandong Miao
languages.area: East Guizhou Province, Jianhe, Jinping and Liping counties; west Hunan Province, Huitong, Jingzhou and Tongdao counties.

languages.name: Southern Qiandong Miao

languages.name: Western Mashan Hmong
languages.area: South Guizhou Province, Wangmo, Ziyun counties.

languages.name: Southern Guiyang Hmong
languages.area: South central Guizhou Province, Changshun, Ziyun Zhenning counties, Anshun Municipality.

languages.name: Hmong Shua
languages.autonym: lus Hmoob / lug Moob / lol Hmongb
languages.area: Western Guizhou Province, Dafang, Guanling, Nayong, Pu’an, Puding, Qianxi, Qinglong, Shuicheng, Xingren, Zhenning, Zhijin, and Ziyun counties; southeastern Yunnan Province, Wenshan , Honghe prefectures; northwestern Guangxi Province, Longlin County; Anshun and Xingyi cities. Also in Viet Nam.

languages.name: Hani
languages.area: South Yunnan, Jingdong and Jinggu counties, Yuanjiang and Lancang (Mekong) river basins, Ailao Mountains. Also in Laos, Viet Nam.

languages.name: Hmong Njua
languages.autonym: lus Hmoob / lug Moob / lol Hmongb
languages.area: North. Also in Australia, Canada, China, France, French Guiana, Myanmar, Thailand, United States, Viet Nam.

languages.name: Honi
languages.area: South Yunnan Province, east Simao Prefecture, Mojiang Hani, Pu’er Hani, Yi, and Dai autonomous counties; Yuxi Municipal Prefecture, Yuanjiang Hani, and Yi and Dai autonomous counties.

languages.name: Horned Miao
languages.autonym: lus Hmoob / lug Moob / lol Hmongb
languages.area: Northeastern Yunnan, Zhenxiong County, Guiyang, Bijie, Qingzhen cities; northwest and central Guizhou, Dafang, Nayong and Zhijin counties.

languages.name: Xiang Chinese
languages.area: Hunan Province, Sichuan Province, over 20 counties; parts of Guangxi and Guangdong provinces. Also in United States.

languages.name: Northern Guiyang Hmong
languages.area: Central Guizhou Province, Jinsha, Qianxi, Xifeng, Kaiyang, Xiuwen, Pingba Guiding counties, west Guiyang municipality suburbs.

languages.name: Hu
languages.area: Southwest Yunnan Province, Xishuangbanna Dai Autonomous Prefecture, Mengla and Jinghong counties, 5 villages, including Nahuopa village in Jinghong, Mengyang Township.

languages.name: Tsat
languages.area: South Hainan Prefecture; Yaxian (Sanya) County, Yanglan District, Huixin and Huihui villages.

languages.name: Sichuan Yi
languages.area: North Yunnan, south Sichuan, mainly in Greater and Lesser Liangshan mountains. Spoken in over 40 counties.

languages.name: Ili Turki
languages.area: Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region, Ili Kazak Autonomous Prefecture, Tekes, Nilka, Xinyuan, Gongliu, Zhaosu, and other counties, Ili Valley near Kuldja. Also in Kazakhstan.

languages.name: Indonesian
languages.area: Widespread in Indonesia. Also in Netherlands, Philippines, Saudi Arabia, Singapore, United States.

languages.name: Iu Mien
languages.area: Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region, Dayao Mountains, Guangdong in Ruyuan County, Yunnan, Hunan provinces; Guizhou Province, Rongjiang, Congjiang, and Libo counties. Also in Belgium, Denmark, France, Laos, Myanmar, New Zealand, Switzerland, Thailand, United States, Viet Nam.

languages.name: sTodsde
languages.area: North central Sichuan, south Rangthang County, Shangzhai District, Shili, Zongke, and Puxi townships, near confluence of Duke River and its tributary Zhongke River.

languages.name: Jiamao
languages.area: South Hainan Province, Baoting, Lingshui, and Qiongzhong counties, near Wuzhi Mountain.

languages.name: Guanyinqiao
languages.area: North central Sichuan, southwest tip of Maerkang County, Jinchuan River tributaries; northwest Jinchuan County; southeast Rangtang County.

languages.name: Youle Jinuo
languages.area: South Yunnan, Xishuangbanna Dai Autonomous Prefecture, near Laos and Myanmar borders, east of Jinghong. Youle Mountains. 40 villages.

languages.name: Buyuan Jinuo
languages.area: South Yunnan, Xishuangbanna Dai Autonomous Prefecture, near Laos and Myanmar borders, east of Jinghong. Youle Mountains. 40 villages.

languages.name: Japanese
languages.area: Widespread. Also in American Samoa, Argentina, Australia, Belize, Brazil, Canada, Dominican Republic, Germany, Guam, Mexico, Micronesia, Mongolia, New Zealand, Northern Mariana Islands, Palau, Panama, Paraguay, Philippines, Singapore, Taiwan, Thailand, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, United States.

languages.name: Jiarong
languages.area: North central Sichuan. Situ is in the traditional territory of 4 chieftaincies: Zhuokeji, Suomo, Songgang, Dangba. Chabao is in northeast corner of Maerkang County, Chabao District, Longerjia, Dazang, and Shaerzong townships. Sidaba is in Maerkang County, Sidaba District, Caodeng, Kangshan, and Ribu townships; north in southwest corner of Aba County, Kehe and Rongan townships; west along middle Duke River, Rangtang County, between Wuyi and Shili townships; and Seda County at the confluence of Seda and Duke rivers, a small town.

languages.name: Kachin
languages.area: Kachin state. Also in China, United States.

languages.name: Katso
languages.area: Yunnan Province, Yuxi Prefecture, Tonghai County, Xingmeng Mongolian Autonomous Township.

languages.name: Kazakh
languages.area: Kazakhstan, northern Soviet Middle Asia into western Siberia. Also in Afghanistan, China, Germany, Iran, Kyrgyzstan, Mongolia, Russian Federation (Asia), Tajikistan, Turkey (Asia), Turkmenistan, Ukraine, United States, Uzbekistan.

languages.name: Kemiehua
languages.area: Southwest Yunnan Province, Xishuangbanna Dai Autonomous Prefecture, Jinghong County.

languages.name: Kyerung
languages.area: Bagmati zone, Rasuwa District, Langtang region, Rasua Garbi, Birdim, Thangjet, Syabru, and Syabrubensi villages; large concentrations in Kathmandu. Also in China.

languages.name: Lü
languages.area: South Yunnan, Jinghong (Chiang Hung, Chien Rung), Xishuangbanna Dai Autonomous Prefecture, west of Lixianjiang (Black) River. Also in Laos, Myanmar, Thailand, Viet Nam.

languages.name: Khuen
languages.area: Luang Namtha Province, Nale, Sing, and Viangphoukha districts. Near Lamet [lbn]. Also in China, United States.

languages.name: Khams Tibetan
languages.area: Northeast Tibet, Changdu (Qamdo) and Naqu (Nagqu) districts; west Sichuan, Ganzi (Garzê) Tibetan Autonomous Prefecture; northwest Yunnan Province, Diqing (Dêqên) Tibetan Autonomous Prefecture; southwest Qinghai Province, Yushu Tibetan Autonomous Prefecture.

languages.name: Halh Mongolian
languages.area: Former Buryat Autonomous Soviet Socialist Republic of the Russian Federation and Issyk-Kul Oblast of Kyrgyzstan. Also in Kyrgyzstan, Russian Federation (Asia), Taiwan, United States.

languages.name: Kirghiz
languages.area: Widespread. Also in Afghanistan, China, Kazakhstan, Russian Federation (Asia), Tajikistan, Turkey (Asia), United States, Uzbekistan.

languages.name: Khmu
languages.area: Scattered in north. Also in China, France, Myanmar, Thailand, United States, Viet Nam.

languages.name: Khakas
languages.area: Khakassia (Khakasia) Republic, north of Altai Mountains; Krasnoyarsk Territory, north of Khakassia Republic; Tuva Republic; scattered throughout the federation. Also in China.

languages.name: Southern Dong
languages.area: Area where west Hunan and north Guangxi provinces meet, southeast Guizhou (Yuping Autonomous County); Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region. 20 contiguous counties.

languages.name: Korean
languages.area: Also in American Samoa, Australia, Bahrain, Belize, Brazil, Brunei, Canada, China, Germany, Guam, Japan, Kazakhstan, North Korea, Kyrgyzstan, Libya, Mauritania, Mongolia, Mozambique, New Zealand, Northern Mariana Islands, Panama, Paraguay, Philippines, Russian Federation (Asia), Saudi Arabia, Singapore, Suriname, Tajikistan, Thailand, Turkmenistan, United States, Uzbekistan.

languages.name: Kaduo
languages.area: Yunnan Province, primarily southeast Simao Prefecture, Pu’er, Mojiang, and Jiangcheng counties. Also in Laos.

languages.name: Kangjia
languages.area: Qinghai Province, Huangnan Tibetan Autonomous Prefecture, Jainca County, Shalimu, Zongzila, and Hangdao villages.

languages.name: Kang
languages.area: Houaphan Province, Xam-Tai District; Xiangkhoang Province, Nonghet District. Also in China.

languages.name: Qabiao
languages.area: Hà Giang Province, Viet Nam-Yunnan-Kwangsi border, upper Clear River valley, Dunshi, Pugao, Pula, Pubang, Manong; Yên Minh and Mèo Vac districts; Dông Van District, Phô Là and Sung Chang villages. Also in China.

languages.name: Lakkia
languages.area: Eastern Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region, Jinxiu Yao Autonomous County.

languages.name: Tinani
languages.area: Himachal Pradesh, Lahul and Spiti Subdivision, lower Chandra, Tinan, Rangloi Valleys; Gondhla main village. Also in China.

languages.name: Lachi
languages.area: Hà Giang Province, west of Hà Giang in upper Clear River valley (Riviere Claire) on the China border. Black Lachi in Manyou, Long-Haired Lachi in Manpeng. Also in China.

languages.name: Lahu Shi
languages.area: South Yunnan Province, Xishuangbanna Dai Autonomous Prefecture, Menghai District, Menghai County (Menghai Township); Simao Prefecture, Lancang Lahu Autonomous County, Nuofu District, other areas. Also in Laos, Myanmar, Thailand, United States.

languages.name: Lhomi
languages.area: Koshi zone, Sankhuwasawa District, Chepuwa VDC, Chepuwa, Chyamtang, Gumba, Chhumusur, Rukuma (or Ridak) villages; Hatiya VDC, Hatiya, Hungung, Pharang, Syaksila, Simbung (or Shembung), Namase (or Namuchhe), Shiprung villages; some in Kathmandu. Also in China, India.

languages.name: Lahu
languages.area: Southwest Yunnan Province, Simao Prefecture, Lancang Lahu, Menglian Dai, Lahu & Va autonomous counties; Lincang Prefecture, Gengma Dai, Va autonomous counties. Also in Laos, Myanmar, Thailand, Viet Nam.

languages.name: Hlai
languages.area: Central and southern Hainan Province, Wanning, Tunchang, Danxiang, Chengmai, Baisha.

languages.name: Lisu
languages.area: West Yunnan Province, 11 prefectures, 63 counties, upper reaches of Salween and Mekong rivers; Sichuan Province, southwest Liangshan Prefecture. Also in India, Myanmar, Thailand.

languages.name: Kucong
languages.area: Lai Chau Province, Muang Te District. Also in China.

languages.name: Lamu
languages.area: Yunnan Province, Dali Prefecture, Northeast Binchuan County.

languages.name: Lopi
languages.area: Possibly also in China.

languages.name: Lipo
languages.area: North-central Yunnan Province in Luquan, Wuding, Lufeng, Yuanmo, Yongsheng, Dayao, Binchuan, Yuanmo, Yongren, Yao’an counties; south Sichuan Province, Renhe County.

languages.name: Lashi
languages.autonym: လရှီ / လချစ်
languages.area: Htawgaw Subdivision, Kachin state. Also in China.

languages.name: Laomian
languages.area: Yunnan Province, northwest Lancang County; Menglian County.

languages.name: Digaro-Mishmi
languages.area: Arunachal Pradesh, Lohit District, Hayuliang, Changlagam, Goiliang circles, Dibang Valley District; Assam. Also in China.

languages.name: Maru
languages.area: Kachin state, eastern border area, widely dispersed, north Myanmar. Also in China.

languages.name: Tu
languages.area: East Qinghai Province, Huzhu Tu Autonomous County; Gansu Province.

languages.name: Kim Mun
languages.area: Yunnan Province, seventeen counties; Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region, thirteen counties; Hainan Province, 7 counties. Also in Laos, Viet Nam.

languages.name: Mak (China)
languages.area: Guizhou Province, northwest Libo County, Yangfeng, Fangcun, Jialiang, and Di’e villages; some in neighboring Dushan County.

languages.name: Cao Lan
languages.area: San Chay mainly in Tuyen Quang, Bac Can, and Thai Nguyen provinces; also scattered in Yen Bai, Vinh Phuc, Phu Tho, Bac Giang, Quang Ninh provinces.

languages.name: Mulam
languages.area: North central Guizhou Province, Luocheng Mulam Autonomous County (90% in Dongmen and Siba communes), adjacent counties, Majiang and Kaili City.

languages.name: Maonan
languages.area: North central Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region, Huanjiang Maonan Autonomous County, Xianan; a few in nearby Hechi, Yishan, Nandan, Du’an counties.

languages.name: Man Met
languages.area: Southwest Yunnan Province, 5 communities in Xishuangbanna Dai Autonomous Prefecture near the Hu.

languages.name: Western Xiangxi Miao
languages.area: Northwest Hunan Province, Huadan, Fenghuang, Baojing, Jishou, Guzhang, Longshan, Xinhuang Mayang counties; northeast Guizhou Province, Songtao County, Tongren and southeast Chongqing municipalities; Xiushan and Youyang counties; southwest Hubei Province, Xuan’en County; north Guangxi Province, Nandan County, Hechi municipality.

languages.name: Manchu
languages.area: Heilongjiang, a few Manchu-speaking villages in Aihui and Fuyu counties.

languages.name: Min Bei Chinese
languages.area: North Fujian Province, 7 counties around Jian’ou. Also in Singapore.

languages.name: Eastern Xiangxi Miao
languages.area: West Hunan Province, Luxi, Guzhang, Jishou and Longshan counties, some in Hubei.

languages.name: Peripheral Mongolian
languages.area: Inner Mongolia, Liaoning, Jilin, and Heilongjiang provinces, Urumchi to Hailar. Also in Mongolia.

languages.name: Muya
languages.area: West central Sichuan, Kangbo (Kangding) and Jiulong (Gyaisi) in the Ganzi (Garzê) Tibetan Autonomous Prefecture, and Simian (Shimian) County in the Ya’an District.

languages.name: Hmong Daw
languages.autonym: lus Hmoob / lug Moob / lol Hmongb
languages.area: South and southwest Guizhou, northwest Guangxi, southeast and southwest Yunnan. Also in France, Laos, Thailand, United States, Viet Nam.

languages.name: Miju-Mishmi
languages.area: Arunachal Pradesh, Lohit District, 25 villages, high altitudes of east, upper Lohit and Dau valleys, area east of Haguliang, Billong, and Tilai valleys; Assam. Also in China.

languages.name: Burmese
languages.area: South, central, and adjacent areas. Also in Bangladesh, Malaysia (Peninsular), Thailand, United States.

languages.name: Macanese
languages.area: Macau, Hong Kong. Possibly in USA.

languages.name: Min Nan Chinese
languages.area: South Fujian, Guangdong, south Hainan Island, south Zhejiang, south Jiangxi provinces. Xiamen in south Fujian, Jiangxi, and Taiwan; Hainan in Hainan; Leizhou on Leizhou peninsula of southwest Guangdong; Chao-Shan in far east corner of Guangdong in Chaozhou-Shantou area; Longdu is a dialect island around Zhongshan City and Shaxi in Guangdong south of Guangzhou; Zhenan Min in southeast Zhejiang Province around Pingyang and Cangnan and on Zhoushan archipelago of northeast Zhejiang. Also in Brunei, Cambodia, Indonesia (Java and Bali), Malaysia (Peninsular), Philippines, Singapore, Taiwan, Thailand, United States.

languages.name: Namuyi
languages.area: Liangshan Yi Autonomous Prefecture, Mianning, Muli, Xichang, Yanyuan counties; southwest Sichuan, Ganzi (Garzê) Tibetan Autonomous Prefecture, Jiulong (Gyaisi) County.

languages.name: Eastern Nisu
languages.area: Yunnan, Jianshui, Tonghai, Gejiu, Kaiyuan, Mengzi, Pingbian, Hekou counties.

languages.name: Southern Nisu
languages.area: Yunnan Province, Honghe, Yuanyang, Mojiang, Simao, Lüchun (Eastern), Jinping, Pu’er, Shiping (Southern), Yuanjiang (Southeastern) counties.

languages.name: Southwestern Nisu
languages.area: Yunnan Province, Jiangcheng, Simao, Mojiang, Lüchun (western), Pu’er counties.

languages.name: Nusu
languages.area: Yunnan Province, Nujiang Lusu Autonomous Prefecture, south Fugong and northeast Lushui counties.

languages.name: Anong
languages.area: North Myanmar. Thanlwin (Salween) (Nu) River. Also in China.

languages.name: Walungge
languages.area: Mechi zone, Taplejung District, Tamar valley, Walungchung, Yangma, Gunsa, Lilip, and Lungtung, some smaller villages; Amjilesa, and Kambachen. Also in India.

languages.name: Lingao
languages.area: Hainan north central coast, Lingao County, parts of Danxian, Chengmai, and Qiongshan counties, Haikou City suburbs.

languages.name: Sartang
languages.area: Arunachal Pradesh, West Kameng District, Nafra and Dirang circles, Jerigaon, Sellary, Khoitam, Rahung, Darbu and Khoina villages.

languages.name: Oroqen
languages.area: Heilongjiang Province, Hinggan Ling Prefecture, Tahe, Huma, Da, Xunke counties; Heihe Prefecture, Heihe City; Yichun Prefecture, Jiayin County; Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region. Oroqen and Butha banners of Hulun Buir League.

languages.name: Bouyei
languages.area: Guizhou-Yunnan plateau, mainly Buyi-Miao and Miao-Dong autonomous prefectures, Zhenning and Guanling counties, south and southwest Guizhou; Yunnan Province, Luoping County; Sichuan Province, Ningnan and Huidong counties. Also in France, United States, Viet Nam.

languages.name: Ruching Palaung
languages.area: Southern Shan state area near Kalaw. 10,000 square mile area. In Kyawkme area in the northern Shan state. Lashio up to the China border. East of Lashio to the Salween. Some villages east of Salween River in Kokaing area. Also in China, Thailand.

languages.name: Pa Di
languages.area: Yunnan Province, Honghe Hani and Yi prefectures, Hekou and Jinping counties. Also in Viet Nam.

languages.name: Bonan
languages.area: Southwest Gansu Province, Linxia Hui Autonomous Prefecture, Jishishan Bao’an-Dongxiang-Sala Autonomous County; east Qinghai Province, Bonan-speaking Tu in Tongren.

languages.name: Pa-Hng
languages.area: Guizhou Province, Liping, Congjiang counties; northeast Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region, Rongshui, Sanjiang, Longsheng, Rong’an, Lingui counties. Also in Viet Nam.

languages.name: Phukha
languages.area: Lao Cai Province, near Lao Cai City; Hà Giang Province, Xin Mun District, 1 village; Lai Chau and Son La provinces. Also in China.

languages.name: Phana'
languages.area: Luang Namtha Province and District, Bopiet and Namtoung villages; Bokeo Province, Houayxay District, one village.

languages.name: Shwe Palaung
languages.area: Northern Shan state, centered in Nam Hsan. Also in China.

languages.name: Bolyu
languages.area: Far west Guangxi on the Guizhou and Yunnan borders, Xilin and Longlin counties, in 2 groups. Possibly in Yunnan.

languages.name: Northern Pumi
languages.area: Southwest Sichuan, Muli, Yanyuan, and Kiulong counties; northwest Yunnan, Ninglang County, Yongning District.

languages.name: Southern Pumi
languages.area: Northwest Yunnan Province, Lanping, Weixi, Yongsheng, and Lijiang counties; Ninglang County, Xinyingpan District.

languages.name: Jiongnai Bunu
languages.area: East Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region, Jinxiu Yao Autonomous County.

languages.name: Parauk
languages.area: Northeast Shan state, upper Salween River area; East Shan state, Kengtung area. Also in China.

languages.name: Purik
languages.area: North Kashmir, Kargil District, mainly Suru Valley; Dras Valley, some in western Himalayas.

languages.name: Paiwan
languages.area: South, mountains southeast.

languages.name: Queyu
languages.area: West Sichuan, Ganzi (Garzê) Tibetan Autonomous Prefecture, Xinlong (Nyagrong), Yajiang (Nyagquka) Litang counties.

languages.name: Southern Qiang
languages.area: North central Sichuan Province, Minjiang River basin between Zhenjiangguan in Songpan County to the north, and Wenchuan and Li counties to the south, as far east as Beichuan County.

languages.name: Rawang
languages.area: Kachin state, Putao District, north of Myitkyina. Also in India.

languages.name: Rumai Palaung
languages.area: Northern Shan state, around Lashio and the road north to the border, Nam Kham, North Hsenwi, Tawngpeng (the ancient Palaung state), and some east of Lashio and east of the Salween. Also in China.

languages.name: Riang Lang
languages.area: Shan state, northeast Myanmar. Also in China.

languages.name: Yakut
languages.area: Sakha, near Arctic Ocean, the length of middle Lena River, Aldan and Kolyma rivers, 3220 km.

languages.name: Dongxiang
languages.area: Southwest Gansu Province, Linxia Hui Autonomous Prefecture, 7 counties and a city; Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region, Ili Kazak Autonomous Prefecture, Yining and Huocheng counties.

languages.name: Sangkong
languages.area: South Yunnan Province, Xishuangbanna Dai Autonomous Prefecture, Jinghong County, Xiaojie (3 villages) and Menglong (1 village) districts.

languages.name: Shan
languages.area: Shan state, southeast Myanmar. Kokang Shan is in Kokang area, north Wa area, Shan state; Tai Mao is on Burma-Yunnan border, centered at Mu’ang Mao Long or Namkham, Myanmar. Also in China, Thailand.

languages.name: She
languages.area: Southeast Guangdong Province. Luofu in Boluo and Zengcheng counties, Lianhua in Haifeng and Huidong counties. More than 10 villages.

languages.name: Xibe
languages.area: Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region, Qapqal, Huocheng, Gongliu, Xinyuan, Nilka, Tekes and Zhaosu counties; Ili Prefecture, Yining City; Tacheng Prefecture, Tacheng County; Bortala Prefecture, Bole County, Ürümqi City.

languages.name: Salar
languages.area: Qinghai Province, Xunhua Salar Autonomous, Hualong Hui autonomous counties; Gansu Province, Jishishan Autonomous County; Xinjiang, Yining.

languages.name: Samei
languages.area: Yunnan Province, Guandu District, Kunming City, Ala and surrounding communities (47 villages); west Yiliang County (7 villages).

languages.name: Sarikoli
languages.area: Southwest Xinjiang, Taxkorgan (Tashkurghan) area, Sarikol Valley.

languages.name: Samtao
languages.area: East Shan state. Also in China, Laos, Thailand.

languages.name: Puroik
languages.area: Arunachal Pradesh, East Kameng, Papumpare, Kurung Kumey, Lower Subansiri districts, along Par River. 53 villages. Possibly also in China.

languages.name: Sui
languages.area: Guangxi and northeast Yunnan; Guizhou: Sandu, and Libo districts; Guangxi: Nandan District. Also in Viet Nam.

languages.name: Shuhi
languages.area: Southwest Sichuan, Liangshan Yi Autonomous Prefecture, Muli Tibetan Autonomous County.

languages.name: Tatar
languages.area: Tatarstan and Bashkortostan Republics; St. Petersburg and Moscow to eastern Siberia. Also in Afghanistan, Azerbaijan, Belarus, China, Estonia, Finland, Georgia, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Latvia, Lithuania, Moldova, Tajikistan, Turkey (Europe), Turkmenistan, Ukraine, United States, Uzbekistan.

languages.name: T'en
languages.area: Guizhou Province, east Pingtang County; Dushan County; Huishui, just south of Guiyang.

languages.name: Tai Nüa
languages.area: South central Yunnan, Dehong Prefecture, southwest of Dali near Lancang (Mekong) River. May be in north Viet Nam. Also in France, Laos, Myanmar, Switzerland, Thailand.

languages.name: Tajik
languages.area: Also in Iran, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Russian Federation (Asia), Turkmenistan, Ukraine, Uzbekistan.

languages.name: Thangmi
languages.area: Most in Janakpur zone, Dolakha District; villages in Bagmati zone, Sindhupalchok District, west of the Sun Kosi; a few villages in Ramechhap along the Sailung Khola. Also in China, India.

languages.name: Tai Hongjin
languages.area: Southeast and north Yunnan Province, Sichuan north of the Yangtze at Huili and Takou. Chuxiong Yi Autonomous Prefecture, Yongren, Wuding and Dayao counties; Kunming Prefecture, Luquan Yi, Miao autonomous counties; Wenshan Zhuang and Miao Autonomous Prefecture, Maguan County; Honghe Hani and Yi Autonomous Prefecture, Honghe, Yuanyang counties; Yuxi Prefecture, Yuanjiang Hani, Yi, Dai autonomous counties; Honghe Hani and Yi Autonomous Prefecture, Lüchun, Shiping, Jianshui counties.

languages.name: Northern Tujia
languages.area: Northwest Hunan, Yingjiang and Yanhe counties, Hubei, Guizhou, Wuling Mt. range.

languages.name: Southern Tujia
languages.area: Northwest Hunan Province, Luxi County. 3 villages.

languages.name: Tshangla
languages.area: East and southeast Bhutan, especially Tashigang and Dungsam. Also in China, India.

languages.name: Tseku
languages.area: Tibetan Autonomous Region. Also in Bhutan, Nepal.

languages.name: Tai Dón
languages.area: Northern Vietnam, along the Red and Black rivers; south now settled mainly in Tung Nghia (Lam Dong Province). Also in China, France, Laos.

languages.name: Tawang Monpa
languages.area: Arunachal Pradesh state, Tawang District. Also in China.

languages.name: Tuvinian
languages.area: Siberia, Tuvin Ao. Also in China, Mongolia.

languages.name: U
languages.area: Southwest Yunnan Province, Baoshan Municipal Prefecture, Shidian and Changning counties. May be in Myanmar.

languages.name: Northern Uzbek
languages.area: East of the Amu Darya; south Aral Sea area. Possibly in Munich, Germany. Also in Australia, China, Israel, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Russian Federation (Asia), Tajikistan, Turkey (Asia), Turkmenistan, Ukraine, United States.

languages.name: Vietnamese
languages.area: Widespread. Also in Australia, Cambodia, Canada, China, Côte d’Ivoire, Czech Republic, Finland, France, Germany, Laos, Martinique, Netherlands, New Caledonia, Norway, Philippines, Russian Federation (Asia), Senegal, Taiwan, Thailand, United Kingdom, United States, Vanuatu.

languages.name: Awa (China)
languages.area: Southwest Yunnan Province, Simao Prefecture: Ximeng Va, Menglian Dai, Lahu and Va, and Lancang Lahu autonomous counties.

languages.name: Wakhi
languages.area: Northeasternmost part of Chitral, called Baroghil area; in glacier neighborhood. Gojal in upper Hunza valley, Gulmit to the Chinese and Afghanistan borders, and Shimshal and Chupursan valleys, upper Yarkhun valley of Chitral, and upper Ishkoman valley. Also in Afghanistan, China, Tajikistan.

languages.name: Wa
languages.area: Southwest Yunnan, Lincang Prefecture, Yongde and Zhenkang counties.

languages.name: Wutunhua
languages.area: East Qinghai Province, Huangnan Tibetan Autonomous Prefecture, Tongren County, Longwu Township, Upper, Lower Wutun and Jiangchama villages.

languages.name: Wu Chinese
languages.area: Jiangsu south of Changjiang River, east of Zhenjiang, on Chongming Island, mouth of the Changjiang, and north of the Changjiang in the area around Nantong, Haimen, Qidong, and Qingjiang; Zhejiang Province south to Quzhou, Jinhua, and Wenzhou. Also in United States.

languages.name: Waxianghua
languages.area: West Hunan Province, a 6,000 sq km area, Wuling Mountains, including Yuanling, Chunxi, Jishou, Guzhang, and Dayong.

languages.name: Kalmyk
languages.area: Republic of Kalmykia, on Volga-Don steppes northwest of the Caspian, north of the Caucasus; lower Volga region, Astrakhan Province. Also in China, Germany, Kyrgyzstan, Mongolia, Taiwan, United States.

languages.name: Kuanhua
languages.area: Southwest Yunnan Province, Xishuangbanna Dai Autonomous Prefecture, Jinghong County.

languages.name: Sherpa
languages.area: Sagarmatha zone, Solu Khumbu District, mountains north. Khumbu is north from Namche Bazaar. Solu is south including Gumdi, Sete, Junbesi, Phaplu, and Sallery villages. Rolwaling area, Janakpur zone north border, Dolakha and Ramechap districts, and Taplejung, Mechi zone. Possibly in Lukla. Also in Bhutan, China, India, South Korea, United States.

languages.name: West Yugur
languages.area: Northwest Gansu Province, Sunan Yugur Autonomous County near Zhangye (Kanchow).

languages.name: Bokha
languages.area: Yunnan Province, central Pingbian, east Jinping, and western Hekou counties.

languages.name: Chesu
languages.area: Yunnan Province, northwest Xinping, southeast Shuangbai, and southwest Eshan counties.

languages.name: Lolopo
languages.area: Central Yunnan Province, Nanhua, Chuxiong, Yao’an, Jingdong, Shuangbai, Mouding, and Lufeng counties primarily.

languages.name: Chepya
languages.area: Southern Yunnan Province. Also in Laos.

languages.name: Gepo
languages.area: Northeast Yunnan Province: Luquan, Fumin, Xundian, Luxi, Shizong, Luoping, Malong, Songming, Huize, Mile, Shilin, and Dongchuan counties.

languages.name: Baha Buyang
languages.area: Yunnan Province, Wenshan Zhuang-Miao Autonomous Prefecture, northern Guangnan County, Dixu District, Yanglian village; Bada District, Anshe village.

languages.name: Hlepho Phowa
languages.area: Yunnan Province, southwest Yanshan, north Mengzi, west Weshan, and north Pingbian counties.

languages.name: Ache
languages.area: Yunnan Province, Shuangbai, Yimen, Eshan, and Lufeng counties.

languages.name: Wusa Nasu
languages.area: Guizhou Province, Weining Yi-Hui-Miao Autonomous, Dafang Autonomous, Hezhang, and Pan counties; west Guangxi, Baise District.

languages.name: Dongshanba Lalo
languages.area: West Yunnan, in Weishan, Yangbi, Midu, Xiaguan, Yongping, Baoshan, and Lancang counties.

languages.name: Pholo
languages.area: Yunnan Province, northeast Yanshan County, southeast Qiubei County; east Yanshan, west Guangnan, northeast Malipo counties, scattered.

languages.name: Miqie
languages.area: Yunnan Province, Wuding (Jincheng, Jiuchang, and Chadian districts), north Fumin, north Lufeng, south Luquan counties, parts of Yongren, Dayao, Yao’an, Nanhua, Jingdong, Zhenyuan, Jinggu, Yimen counties.

languages.name: Eastern Lalu
languages.area: Yunnan, in Xinping, Zhenyuan, Mojiang, and Yuanjiang counties.

languages.name: Awu
languages.area: Yunnan Province, primarily north Honghe Prefecture, Mile and Luxi counties; south Qujing Prefecture, Shizong and Luoping counties.

languages.name: Northern Nisu
languages.area: Yunnan Province, Eshan, Xinping, Shiping (North), Yimen, Yuxi, Jiangchuan, Shuangbai, Jinning, Chengjiang, Northern Yuanjiang counties.

languages.name: Axi Yi
languages.area: Southeast Yunnan Province, Mile and Luxi counties. Shilin County, 1 village.

languages.name: Azhe
languages.area: Yunnan Province, Mile County: Xun Jian, Wushan, Jiangbian districts; Huaning County, Panxi District; north Kaiyuan County, Xiaolongtan District, Xiaolongtan Community; Lebaidao District, Jiedian Community; Mazheshao District, Chongzi Community; northeast Jianshui County, 1 village.

languages.name: Khlula
languages.area: Yunnan Province, southeast Wenshan County, northern and central parts of Maguan County.

languages.name: Kathu
languages.area: Yunnan Province, Guangnan County, Balong District. Possibly in Guangxi.

languages.name: Limi
languages.area: Yunnan, in Yongde, Fengqing, Yunxian counties.

languages.name: Langnian Buyang
languages.area: Yunnan Province, Wenshan Zhuang-Miao Autonomous Prefecture, Funing County, Gula Township, Langjia and Nianlang villages.

languages.name: Naluo Yi
languages.area: Yunnan, Qiaojia, Wuding, Luquan, Yuanmou, Huize counties.

languages.name: Southern Muji
languages.area: Yunnan Province, north Jinping County; some in southwest and east Jinping County, south Mengzi County, southeast Gejiu County.

languages.name: Muda
languages.area: Yunnan Province, Jinghong County, Nanpianshan District.

languages.name: Mili
languages.area: Yunnan Province, Jingdong, Yunxian, Zhenyuan, Xinping counties.

languages.name: Moji
languages.area: Yunnan Province, south and southwest Wenshan County; west Xichou County, Luchaichong village; possibly east Fumin County.

languages.name: Qila Muji
languages.area: Yunnan Province, south Jinping County. 2 isolated villages.

languages.name: Northern Muji
languages.area: Yunnan Province, south Mengzi County, west Pingbian County.

languages.name: Muzi
languages.area: Yunnan Province, south and east Gejiu County; west Mengzi County, scattered villages.

languages.name: Aluo
languages.area: Yunnan Province, north Wuding, Luquan, Yuanmou counties; Sichuan Province, Huili, Miyi counties.

languages.name: Lang'e
languages.area: Yunnan Province, southwest Yongsheng County.

languages.name: Phala
languages.area: Yunnan Province, Shiping, Honghe counties, north and south banks of Yuanjiang (Honghe) River; Yuanyang, Jianshui counties, a few isolated villages downriver.

languages.name: Labo Phowa
languages.area: Yunnan Province, central, north-central and southeast Kaiyuan County.

languages.name: Phola
languages.area: Yunnan Province, Yuanjiang, Shiping, Honghe counties, along confluence of Yuanjiang (Honghe) and Xiaohedi rivers.

languages.name: Phupha
languages.area: Yunnan Province, southwest Gejiu County. 4 villages; Yuangyang County, across Honghe River. 1 village.

languages.name: Phuma
languages.area: Yunnan Province, east-central Pingbian County.

languages.name: Ani Phowa
languages.area: Yunnan Province, north central Mengzi County, Xibeile District; south Kaiyuan County, Yangjie District.

languages.name: Alo Phola
languages.area: Yunnan Province, Yuanjiang County, Tuguozhai village.

languages.name: Phupa
languages.area: Yunnan Province, southwest Mengzi County; southeast corner of Gejiu panhandle.

languages.name: Phuza
languages.area: Yunnan Province, southwest Mengzi and southeast Gejiu counties.

languages.name: Yerong
languages.area: West Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region, Baise Prefecture, Napo County, on the Yunnan Province and Viet Nam border; Longhe District, Rongtun and Gonghe villages; Pohe District, Shanhe, Yong’an and Guoba.

languages.name: Samatao
languages.area: Guandu District, Kunming Municipality, Zijun village. A few elderly speakers in Zhenkang and Yongde.

languages.name: Sani
languages.area: Southeast Yunnan, Shilin, Yilang, Mile, Luxi, Qiubei counties.

languages.name: Nisi (China)
languages.area: Southeast Yunnan, Wenshan, Yanshan, Maguan, Funing, Xichou, Malipo, Honghe counties.

languages.name: Southern Lolopo
languages.area: Yunnan, in Jingdong, Jinggu, Lancang, Zhenyuan, Simao, Pu’er counties.

languages.name: Sanie
languages.area: Yunnan Province, north Anning County, Kunming Municipality, Xishan District; southwest Fumin County.

languages.name: Tanglang
languages.area: Northwest Yunnan Province, south Lijiang County, Tai’an District, Hongmai Community. Locals call this area “Tanglangba” or Tanglang Basin.

languages.name: Thopho
languages.area: Yunnan Province, Guangnan County, South-central Zhetu District; northeast Zhulin District.

languages.name: Yue Chinese
languages.area: Guangdong (except Hakka speaking areas northeast, Min Nan-speaking areas east, Hainan Island); Guangxi. Hong Kong and Macau. Also in Australia, Brunei, Canada, Costa Rica, Honduras, Indonesia (Java and Bali), Malaysia (Peninsular), Mauritius, Nauru, Netherlands, New Zealand, Panama, Philippines, Singapore, South Africa, Thailand, United Kingdom, United States, Viet Nam.

languages.name: East Yugur
languages.area: Northwest Gansu Province, east Sunan Yugur Autonomous County, Kangle, Mati, and Dahe districts.

languages.name: Western Lalu
languages.area: West Yunnan, in Baoshan, Shidian, Zhenkang, Longling, Luxi counties.

languages.name: Wuding-Luquan Yi
languages.area: Yunnan, Luquan, Wuding, Yongren, Lufeng, Yuanmou, Qujing, Xundian, Huize counties; south Sichuan, Huili County.

languages.name: Xishanba Lalo
languages.area: West Yunnan, in Weishan, Fengqing, Midu, Changning, Lincang, Yunxian, Jingdong, Jinggu, Yongde, Shidian, Nanjian, Yangbi, Zhenkang, Yunlong, Zhenyuan, Binchuan, Eryuan, and Heqing counties.

languages.name: Wumeng Nasu
languages.area: West Guizhou and East Yunnan, in Weining, Shuicheng, Hezhang, Nayong, Xuanwei, Huize, and Yiliang counties; Northwest Yunnan Province, Zhaotong, Yongshan, Daguan, Ludian counties.

languages.name: Ayizi
languages.area: Yunnan Province, Beidacun District, Aimalong village; Shilin County, Beidacun and Banqiao districts.

languages.name: E'ma Buyang
languages.area: Yunnan Province, Wenshan Zhuang-Miao Autonomous Prefecture, Funing County, Gula Township, Langjia and Nianlang villages.

languages.name: Zokhuo
languages.area: Yunnan Province, southeast Wenshan, south Yanshan counties.

languages.name: Zauzou
languages.area: Northwest Yunnan Province, Nujiang Lisu Autonomous Prefecture, Lanping County, Tu’e, Biji, Wupijiang, Guoli, Xiaocun and Jiangmo districts; Lushui County, Luzhang, Shuilizhai and Liukuzhen districts and townships.

languages.name: Central Hongshuihe Zhuang
languages.area: Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region, either side of central stretch of HSH River, including Du’an, Dahua, Mashan, north Shanglin and possibly other border areas such as east Pingguo.

languages.name: Eastern Hongshuihe Zhuang
languages.area: Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region, south of eastern Hongshuihe River and south of Qianjiang River, includes south Shanglin, south Xincheng, south Xingbin, north Guigang, west Guiping and south Wuxuan.

languages.name: Guibei Zhuang
languages.area: Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region: Longsheng, Sanjiang, Yongfu, Rongan, Rongshui, Luocheng, Huanjiang, Hechi, Nandan, Tian’e, Donglan, Bama.

languages.name: Minz Zhuang
languages.area: Southeast Yunnan Province, Wenshan Zhuang and Miao Autonomous Prefecture, Funing County, Langheng District (now part of Tianbeng Township), Sankeshu, Xionggu, Shangmabu, Tianfang, Getao, Gezao, Gecai, Bagan, Na’en, Longnong, Anha villages.

languages.name: Guibian Zhuang
languages.area: Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region; Fengshan, Tianlin, Longlin, Xilin, Lingyun, Leyun; Yunnan, Funing, N. Guangnan.

languages.name: Zhaba
languages.area: Southwest Sichuan Province, Ganzi (Garzê) Tibetan Autonomous Prefecture, Yajiang (Nyagquka) County, Zhamai District; Daofu (Dawu) County, Zhaba District; Litang and Xinlong counties.

languages.name: Dai Zhuang
languages.area: Southeast Yunnan Province, Wenshan Zhuang and Miao Autonomous Prefecture, Wenshan County, Matang, Dehou, Laohuilong, Panzhihua, and Kaihua townships; Yanshan County, Pingyuan Township; Guangnan County, Zhulin Township; Maguan, and Malipo (western edge) counties. Also in Viet Nam.

languages.name: Nong Zhuang
languages.area: Southeast Yunnan Province, Wenshan Zhuang and Miao Autonomous Prefecture, central and west Guangnan, east Yanshan, north Wenshan, Maguan, Xichou, Malipo counties. A few in Funing and Qiubei counties.

languages.name: Zakhring
languages.area: Arunachal Pradesh, Lohit District, Walong and Kibithoo, Lohit River area.

languages.name: Liujiang Zhuang
languages.area: Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region: Liujiang, N. Laibin, Yishan, Liucheng, N. Xincheng.

languages.name: Lianshan Zhuang
languages.area: Guangdong, Lianshan Zhuang, Yao Autonomous prefectures.

languages.name: Liuqian Zhuang
languages.area: Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region, east of Liujiang and north of Qianjiang rivers; includes north Wuxuan, Xiangzhou, Luzhai; possibly Pingle, Yangshuo and Hezhou.

languages.name: Mang
languages.area: Lai Chau Province, triangle-shaped area between Song Da (Black River) and the Nam Na: Nam Nghe, Nam Xung, Nam Ban, Ban Nam Voi, others. Also in China, Thailand.

languages.name: Qiubei Zhuang
languages.area: Southeast Yunnan Province, Wenshan Zhuang and Miao Autonomous Prefecture, Qiubei western edge of Guangnan County; Qujing Municipal Prefecture, Shizong and Luoping counties.

languages.name: Yongbei Zhuang
languages.area: Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region, N. Yongning, Hengxian, Bingyang, Wuming, Pingguo.

languages.name: Yang Zhuang
languages.area: Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region, most Zhuang populations of Jingxi, Debao, and Napo counties; Yunnan Province, Funing County, scattered in Bo’ai, Xinhua, Zhesang, Dongbo, Guichao, Banlun townships and districts. Also in Viet Nam.

languages.name: Youjiang Zhuang
languages.area: Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region, Tiandong, Tianyang, Baise.

languages.name: Yongnan Zhuang
languages.area: South Guangxi, south Yongning, Longan, Fusui, Shangsi, Qinzhou and Fangcheng counties; some in Jingxi County; Yunnan, Funing County. Also in Viet Nam.

languages.name: Zuojiang Zhuang
languages.area: Southwest Guangxi Province, Tiandeng, Daxin, Chongzuo, Ningming, Longzhou and Pingxiang Jingxi counties; Yunnan Province, Funing County, a few villages. Also in Viet Nam.
